thread.title: The One Detail You Probably Missed On Beyoncé's Grammys Dress
thread.title_full: The One Detail You Probably Missed On Beyoncé's Grammys Dress

author: Jenna Guillaume
title: The One Detail You Probably Missed On Beyoncé's Grammys Dress
text:
View this image ›
Valerie Macon / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10532399 2. But there’s one detail on her dress you might have missed… View this image ›
Christopher Polk / Getty Images ID: 10532413 3. Did you see it? Yep, she had a portrait of her own face on her belly, watching over the twins. View this image ›
Christopher Polk / Getty Images She also had two cherubs dressed in ivy on her hips, but they’re hard to see in photos. Peter Dundas, who created the gown, told Vogue , “I like creating stories within a garment. It was a fun way to celebrate the moment for her.”
ID: 10532437 4. Dundas said he took inspiration from Gustav Klimt, Erté, and the lyrics to “Love Drought” for the iconic look. Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @peter_dundas ID: 10532465 5. And the sun rays covering the outfit symbolised Oshun, the West African goddess of fertility, love, and prosperity. View this image ›
Christopher Polk / Getty Images ID: 10532485 I can’t believe Beyoncé invented religion. View this image ›
Valerie Macon / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10532493
 More News About Beyonce Jenna Guillaume is Editor-at-Large Sydney.
